010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.lang.reflect.Array;
015
016/**
017 * This class defines various vector norms for calculating
018 * magnitude and distance.
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 * @version 2022/09/11
022 */
023public abstract class VectorNorm {
024        
025        private VectorNorm() {}
026
027        /**
028         * Returns the magnitude of the specified {@code double[]} vector under this norm.
029         * @param a a vector
030         * @return the magnitude of the vector
031         */
032        public abstract double magnitude(double[] a);
033        
034        /**
035         * Returns the magnitude of the specified {@code float[]} vector under this norm.
036         * @param a a vector
037         * @return the magnitude of the vector
038         */
039        public abstract double magnitude(float[] a);
040        
041        /**
042         * Returns the magnitude of the specified {@code int[]} vector under this norm.
043         * @param a a vector
044         * @return the magnitude of the vector
045         */
046        public abstract double magnitude(int[] a);
047
048        /**
049         * Returns the distance between two {@code double[]} vectors under this norm.
050         * @param a first vector
051         * @param b second vector
052         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
053         */
054        public abstract double distance(double[] a, double[] b);
055        
056        /**
057         * Returns the distance between two {@code float[]} vectors under this norm.
058         * @param a first vector
059         * @param b second vector
060         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
061         */
062        public abstract double distance(float[] a, float[] b);
063        
064        /**
065         * Returns the distance between two {@code int[]} vectors under this norm.
066         * @param a first vector
067         * @param b second vector
068         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
069         */
070        public abstract double distance(int[] a, int[] b);
071
072        /**
073         * Returns the squared distance between two {@code double[]} vectors under this norm.
074         * @param a first vector
075         * @param b second vector
076         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
077         */
078        public abstract double distance2(double[] a, double[] b);
079        
080        /**
081         * Returns the squared distance between two {@code float[]} vectors under this norm.
082         * @param a first vector
083         * @param b second vector
084         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
085         */
086        public abstract double distance2(float[] a, float[] b);
087        
088        /**
089         * Returns the squared distance between two {@code int[]} vectors under this norm.
090         * @param a first vector
091         * @param b second vector
092         * @return the distance between vectors a and b
093         */
094        public abstract double distance2(int[] a, int[] b);
095
096        /**
097         * Returns a factor to scale magnitude and distance values 
098         * to the range of the vector components of dimensionality
099         * n. This is prim. used for scaling color distances (n = 3).
100         * E.g., if components are distributed in [0,255], the distances
101         * multiplied by this factor should again be in [0,255].
102         * 
103         * @param n dimensionality
104         * @return scale factor
105         */
106        public abstract double getScale(int n);
107
108        /**
109         * Enumeration type for {@link VectorNorm} to be used as
110         * parameter choice.
111         */
112        public enum NormType {
113                L1(VectorNorm.L1.getInstance()),
114                L2(VectorNorm.L2.getInstance()),
115                Linf(VectorNorm.Linf.getInstance());
116                                
117                private final VectorNorm inst;
118                
119                private NormType(VectorNorm instance) {
120                        this.inst = instance;
121                }
122                
123                /**
124                 * Returns the {@link VectorNorm} instance associated with this
125                 * enum item.
126                 * @return the {@link VectorNorm} instance
127                 */
128                public VectorNorm getInstance() {
129                        return this.inst;
130                }
131        }
132        
133        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
134        
135        private static void checkLengths(Object a, Object b) {
136                if (Array.getLength(a) != Array.getLength(b)) {
137                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors a, b must be of same length");
138                }
139        }
140                
141//      private static void checkLengths(double[] a, double[] b) {
142//              if (a.length != b.length) {
143//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors must be of same length");
144//              }       
145//      }
146        
147//      private static void checkLengths(float[] a, float[] b) {
148//              if (a.length != b.length) {
149//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors must be of same length");
150//              }       
151//      }
152        
153//      private static void checkLengths(int[] a, int[] b) {
154//              if (a.length != b.length) {
155//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("vectors must be of same length");
156//              }       
157//      }
158
159        //  concrete classes -----------------------------------------------
160
161        public static class L1 extends VectorNorm {
162                
163                private static final L1 instance = new L1();
164                private L1() {}
165                
166                public static L1 getInstance() {
167                        return L1.instance;
168                }
169
170                @Override
171                public double magnitude(double[] a) {
172                        double sum = 0.0;
173                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
174                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i]);
175                        }
176                        return sum;
177                }
178                
179                @Override
180                public double magnitude(float[] a) {
181                        double sum = 0.0;
182                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
183                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i]);
184                        }
185                        return sum;
186                }
187
188                @Override
189                public double magnitude(int[] a) {
190                        long sum = 0;
191                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
192                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i]);
193                        }
194                        return sum;
195                }
196
197                @Override
198                public double distance(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
199                        checkLengths(a, b);
200                        double sum = 0.0;
201                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
202                                double d = a[i] - b[i];
203                                sum = sum + Math.abs(d);
204                        }
205                        return sum;
206                }
207
208                @Override
209                public double distance(final int[] a, final int[] b) {
210                        checkLengths(a, b);
211                        int sum = 0;
212                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
213                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i] - b[i]);
214                        }
215                        return sum;
216                }
217
218                @Override
219                public double distance2(double[] a, double[] b) {
220                        double d = distance(a, b);
221                        return d * d;
222                }
223
224                public double distance2(int[] a, int[] b) {
225                        double d = distance(a, b);
226                        return d * d;
227                }
228
229                @Override
230                public double distance2(float[] a, float[] b) {
231                        double d = distance(a, b);
232                        return d * d;
233                }
234
235                @Override
236                public double distance(float[] a, float[] b) {
237                        checkLengths(a, b);
238                        double sum = 0;
239                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
240                                sum = sum + Math.abs(a[i] - b[i]);
241                        }
242                        return sum;
243                }
244                
245                @Override
246                public double getScale(int n) {
247                        return 1.0 / n;
248                }
249
250        }
251
252        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
253
254        public static class L2 extends VectorNorm {
255                
256                private static final L2 instance = new L2();
257                private L2() {}
258                
259                public static L2 getInstance() {
260                        return L2.instance;
261                }
262
263                @Override
264                public double magnitude(double[] a) {
265                        double sum = 0.0;
266                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
267                                sum = sum + a[i] * a[i];
268                        }
269                        return Math.sqrt(sum);
270                }
271                
272                @Override
273                public double magnitude(float[] a) {
274                        double sum = 0.0;
275                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
276                                sum = sum + Arithmetic.sqr((double) a[i]);
277                        }
278                        return Math.sqrt(sum);
279                }
280
281                @Override
282                public double magnitude(int[] a) {
283                        long sum = 0;
284                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
285                                sum = sum + a[i] * a[i];
286                        }
287                        return Math.sqrt(sum);
288                }
289
290                @Override
291                public double distance(double[] a, double[] b) {
292                        return Math.sqrt(distance2(a, b));
293                }
294
295                @Override
296                public double distance2(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
297                        checkLengths(a, b);
298                        double sum = 0.0;
299                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
300                                double d = a[i] - b[i];
301                                sum = sum + d * d;
302                        }
303                        return sum;
304                }
305
306                @Override
307                public double distance(int[] a, int[] b) {
308                        return Math.sqrt(distance2(a, b));
309                }
310
311                @Override
312                public double distance2(final int[] a, final int[] b) {
313                        checkLengths(a, b);
314                        int sum = 0;
315                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
316                                int d = a[i] - b[i];
317                                sum = sum + d * d;
318                        }
319                        return sum;
320                }
321
322                @Override
323                public double distance(float[] a, float[] b) {
324                        return Math.sqrt(distance2(a, b));
325                }
326                
327                @Override
328                public double distance2(float[] a, float[] b) {
329                        checkLengths(a, b);
330                        double sum = 0.0;
331                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
332                                double d = a[i] - b[i];
333                                sum = sum + d * d;
334                        }
335                        return sum;
336                }
337                
338                @Override
339                public double getScale(int n) {
340                        return Math.sqrt(1.0 / n);
341                }
342
343        }
344
345        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
346
347        public static class Linf extends VectorNorm {
348                
349                private static final Linf instance = new Linf();
350                private Linf() {}
351                
352                public static Linf getInstance() {
353                        return Linf.instance;
354                }
355
356                @Override
357                public double magnitude(double[] a) {
358                        double dmax = 0.0;
359                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
360                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, Math.abs(a[i]));
361                        }
362                        return dmax;
363                }
364                
365                @Override
366                public double magnitude(float[] a) {
367                        float dmax = 0.0f;
368                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
369                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, Math.abs(a[i]));
370                        }
371                        return dmax;
372                }
373
374                @Override
375                public double magnitude(int[] a) {
376                        int dmax = 0;
377                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
378                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, Math.abs(a[i]));
379                        }
380                        return dmax;
381                }
382
383                @Override
384                public double distance(double[] a, final double[] b) {
385                        checkLengths(a, b);
386                        double dmax = 0.0;
387                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
388                                double d = a[i] - b[i];
389                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, Math.abs(d));
390                        }
391                        return dmax;
392                }
393                
394                @Override
395                public double distance2(double[] a, double[] b) {
396                        return sqr(distance(a, b));
397                }
398
399                @Override
400                public double distance(int[] a, final int[] b) {
401                        checkLengths(a, b);
402                        int dmax = 0;
403                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
404                                int d = Math.abs(a[i] - b[i]);
405                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, d);
406                        }
407                        return dmax;
408                }
409                
410                @Override
411                public double distance2(int[] a, int[] b) {
412                        double d = distance(a, b);
413                        return d * d;
414                }
415
416                @Override
417                public double distance2(float[] a, float[] b) {
418                        return sqr(distance(a, b));
419                }
420
421                @Override
422                public double distance(float[] a, float[] b) {
423                        checkLengths(a, b);
424                        float dmax = 0;
425                        for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
426                                float d = Math.abs(a[i] - b[i]);
427                                dmax = Math.max(dmax, d);
428                        }
429                        return dmax;
430                }
431                
432                @Override
433                public double getScale(int n) {
434                        return 1.0;
435                }
436
437        }
438
439}
440
